Welcome to REST API ContactBook’s documentation!¶

REST API ContactBook’s main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Healthcheck endpoint that checks the database connection.

Parameters:

db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If there’s an error connecting to the database.

Returns:

A success message if the database is connected correctly.

Return type:

dict

main.index(request: Request)¶

Root endpoint that serves the index.html template.

Parameters:

request (Request) – The incoming request.

Returns:

The rendered HTML template for the index page.

Return type:

HTMLResponse

async main.startup()¶

Startup event handler for FastAPI application.

Initializes the Redis connection and FastAPI limiter.

async main.user_agent_ban_middleware(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

Middleware to ban user agents based on a ban list.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – The incoming request.

  • call_next (Callable) – The next middleware function in the chain.

Returns:

A JSONResponse with a 403 status code if the user agent is banned, otherwise the response from the next middleware.

Return type:

JSONResponse or Response

REST API ContactBook’s repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Create a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – The schema representing the contact data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session.

  • user (User) – The user to whom the contact belongs.

Returns:

The created contact object.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Delete a contact from the database by its identifier.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The identifier of the contact to delete.

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session.

  • user (User) – The user to whom the contact belongs.

Returns:

The deleted contact object, or None if not found.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession)¶

Retrieve a list of all contacts from the database with limit and offset applied.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to retrieve.

  • offset (int) – The offset from which to start retrieving contacts.

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session.

Returns:

List of all contacts retrieved from the database.

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieve a contact by its identifier.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The identifier of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session.

  • user (User) – The user to whom the contact belongs.

Returns:

The retrieved contact object, or None if not found.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieve a list of contacts from the database with limit and offset applied.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to retrieve.

  • offset (int) – The offset from which to start retrieving contacts.

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session.

  • user (User) – The user whose contacts are to be retrieved.

Returns:

List of contacts retrieved from the database.

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.search(first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Search for contacts by first name, last name, or email address.

Parameters:

  • first_name (str) – The first name to search for.

  • last_name (str) – The last name to search for.

  • email (str) – The email address to search for.

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session.

  • user (User) – The user whose contacts are being searched.

Returns:

List of contacts matching the search criteria.

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.upcoming_birthday(db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieve contacts whose birthdays fall within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session.

  • user (User) – The user whose contacts are being checked.

Returns:

List of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactSchema, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Update an existing contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The identifier of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactSchema) – The schema representing the updated contact data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session.

  • user (User) – The user to whom the contact belongs.

Returns:

The updated contact object, or None if not found.

Return type:

Contact

Change the password for a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object to update.

  • password (str) – The new password.

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session.

Returns:

The updated user object.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → None¶

Set the email confirmation status for a user in the database to True.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session.

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Create a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (UserSchema) – The schema representing the user data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

The created user object.

Return type:

User

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

The retrieved user object, or None if not found.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → User¶

Update the avatar URL for a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • url (str | None) – The new avatar URL. Can be None.

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session.

Returns:

The updated user object.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession)¶

Update the refresh token for a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object to update.

  • token (str | None) – The new refresh token. Can be None.

  • db (AsyncSession) – AsyncSession object representing the database session.

REST API ContactBook’s routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts_router.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – Contact data to create a new contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • user (User) – The current user making the request.

Returns:

Newly created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException 409 – If the contact creation fails due to conflict.

async src.routes.contacts_router.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete a specific contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • user (User) – The current user making the request.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If the specified contact is not found.

async src.routes.contacts_router.get_all_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieve a list of all contacts (for admins and moderators only).

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to retrieve. Defaults to 10, maximum 500.

  • offset (int) – Number of contacts to skip.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

list[ContactResponse]

  • user (User) – The current user making the request.

Returns:

List of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

list[ContactResponse]

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If no upcoming birthdays are found.

Search contacts by first name, last name, or email.

Parameters:

  • first_name (str) – First name to search for.

  • last_name (str) – Last name to search for.

  • email (str) – Email to search for.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • user (User) – The current user making the request.

Returns:

List of matching contacts.

Return type:

list[ContactResponse]

REST API ContactBook’s routes Users¶

async src.routes.users_router.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Update the user’s avatar.

This function uses RateLimiter to limit the number of requests to 1 per 20 seconds.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile - the uploaded avatar file.

  • user – User object obtained from auth_service.get_current_user.

  • db – AsyncSession - the database session.

Returns:

UserResponse - the updated user object.

  • password (str) – New password.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

Password change confirmation message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException 400 – If the password change fails.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

Confirmation message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException 400 – If the email verification fails.

async src.routes.auth_router.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Authenticate user login.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

Access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenSchema

Raises:

HTTPException 401 – If the email is invalid or the account is not confirmed.

async src.routes.auth_router.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh authentication token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – HTTP Authorization Credentials containing refresh token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

New access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenSchema

Raises:

HTTPException 401 – If the refresh token is invalid.

async src.routes.auth_router.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Request email confirmation.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – Email request data.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – BackgroundTasks to execute background tasks.

  • request (Request) – HTTP request object.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

Confirmation message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException 400 – If the email is already confirmed.

async src.routes.auth_router.reset_password(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Reset user password.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – Email request data.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – BackgroundTasks to execute background tasks.

  • request (Request) – HTTP request object.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

Password reset message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException 400 – If the user email is not found.

async src.routes.auth_router.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Register a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserSchema) – User data to create a new user.

  • bt (BackgroundTasks) – BackgroundTasks to execute background tasks.

  • request (Request) – HTTP request object.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

Newly created user.

Return type:

UserResponse

Raises:

HTTPException 409 – If the account already exists.

REST API ContactBook’s services Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

A class that handles authentication and authorization in a FastAPI application.

This class includes methods for password hashing and verification, token creation and decoding, and user retrieval from the database. It also includes a RoleAccess class for managing role-based access control.

Attributes:

pwd_context (CryptContext): The cryptographic context for password hashing and verification. SECRET_KEY (str): The secret key used for JWT encoding and decoding. ALGORITHM (str): The algorithm used for JWT encoding and decoding. cache (Redis): The Redis cache instance for storing user data. oauth2_scheme (OAuth2PasswordBearer): The OAuth2 password bearer instance for token retrieval.

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret'¶
cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create a new access token.

Parameters:

  • data – The data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta – The number of seconds the token should be valid for.

Returns:

The encoded access token.

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Create a new email token.

Parameters:

data – The data to encode in the token.

Returns:

The encoded email token.

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create a new refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data – The data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta – The number of seconds the token should be valid for.

Returns:

The encoded refresh token.

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decode a refresh token and return the email.

Parameters:

refresh_token – The refresh token to decode.

Returns:

The email contained in the refresh token.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or has an invalid scope.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Get the current user based on the provided token.

Parameters:

  • token – The JWT token to decode.

  • db – The database session.

Returns:

The current user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or the user cannot be found.

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Decode an email token and return the email.

Parameters:

token – The email token to decode.

Returns:

The email contained in the token.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid.

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Generate a hashed password from the plain password.

Parameters:

password – The plain password to hash.

Returns:

The hashed password.

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verify if the plain password matches the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password – The plain password to verify.

  • hashed_password – The hashed password to compare with.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

REST API ContactBook’s services Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Send a verification email to the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • email – The user’s email address.

  • username – The user’s username.

  • host – The host URL for the email verification link.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there are connection issues with the email server.

async src.services.email.send_email_password(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Send a password reset email to the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • email – The user’s email address.

  • username – The user’s username.

  • host – The host URL for the password reset link.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there are connection issues with the email server.

REST API ContactBook’s services Roles¶

class src.services.roles.RoleAccess(allowed_roles: list[Role])¶

Bases: object

A class to manage role-based access control in a FastAPI application.

This class is designed to be used as a dependency in a FastAPI route. It uses the auth_service.get_current_user function to get the current user, and then checks if the user’s role is in the list of allowed roles.

Parameters:

allowed_roles – A list of roles that are allowed to access a specific resource.
